alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Oxford, southwestern Androscoggin and northwestern Cumberland Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bridgton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Bridgton, Mechanic Falls, Naples, Raymond, Waterford, Casco, Harrison, Buckfield, Hebron, New Gloucester, Otisfield, Sweden, Poland, Minot, Oxford, Paris, and Norway. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 69 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western and southwestern Maine.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Southern Oxford
